info.title: The Cancer Imaging Archive
info.description:
NOTE: You need an API-Key to use this API. See README for more details.
The Cancer Imaging Archive (TCIA) is a public repository of cancer images and related clinical data for the express purpose of enabling open science research. Currently over 26 million radiologic images of cancer are contained in this repository. The API allows you to query metadata and download images from the various public collections available on TCIA

get.description: Set of all body part names filtered by query keys

parameters.name: BodyPartExamined
parameters.description: Standard DICOM definition (0018x0015)

parameters.name: Collection
parameters.description: A label used to name a set of images collected for a specific trial or other reason.  Assigned during the process of curating the data.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specify output type. Allowed values CSV/HTML/XML/JSON

parameters.name: Modality
parameters.description: Standard DICOM definition (0008x0060)

get.description: Set of all TCIA collection names

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specify output type. Allowed values CSV/HTML/XML/JSON

get.description: Set of images in a zip file. NOTE: The resulting zip files can become very large. We strongly advise not testing  this endpoint via Mashape. Instead, consider using curl with the -o option set to output.zip

parameters.name: SeriesInstanceUID
parameters.description: Has been de-identified as part of submission process. (DICOM Tag 0020x000E)
